reviewText: DEADLY EXECUTION is filled with action-packed intrigue, bizarre twists and the highest stakes of all: survival itself! These older non-USA titles feature many famous actors and are a nice set of little-seen espionage and adventure movies. SYNOPSES: "Deadly Recruits" - A western intelligence agent plays a game of bluff and counter-bluff against the KGB's most dangerous spies. "The Death Merchants" - An innocent German citizen is pursued by Middle Eastern terrorists after he accidentally sees a message left for a double-agent named Herzog at the Hamburg airport. "The Sell-Out" - A retired CIA agent reluctantly returns to espionage at the request of his treacherous student, who has defected to the Soviet Union. Now the agent wants out, causing both the US and the USSR to send their best hit men after him. "The Treasure Of The Amazon" - In the steamy jungle, a group of adventurers search for a legendary river supposedly filled with diamonds "the size of your eyes." The explorers not only compete against each other, but also must survive ferocious alligators, a tribe of topless female warriors, piranhas, and headhunters. For more explosive action, check out DANGEROUS CURVES 4 MOVIE PACK. . Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website. (7.1) Deadly Recruits (UK/Canada-TV-1986) - Terence Stamp/Carmen du Sautoy/Michael Culver (4.3) The Death Merchants (W Ger/Israel-1973) - Hardy Kruger/Jason Robards Jr./Jennifer Jason Leigh (uncredited) (5.0) The Sell-Out (Israel/Italy/UK-1976) - Richard Widmark/Oliver Reed/Sam Wanamaker (5.2) The Treasure Of The Amazon (Mexico-1985) - Donald Pleasence/Stuart Whitman/Bradford Dillman/John Ireland
